column4: hi guys, I have a question regarding root. I have files on a removable drive which are read only/ About a week ago, I was looking for ways to access those files and found a command that allows me to use root but in fileview form (as in not in the terminal) and I deleted those files which I needed gone. Now I didn't realize that ubuntu had a hidden trash folder, and I needed those files gone, now when I realized this i tried to get back into t
was that the command to gain the root access or does it just empty the trashbin
Oh, just where user trash is stored if you were using Nautilus as root, or whichever user.
